extends QItem

          returns length of the arrow, which is defined to be the distance between its vertices, not the distance between the actual endpoints of the arrow as drawn
 double px()
          returns x component of unit vector perpendicular to arrow, where the unit vector is normalized so that its x component is non-negative
 double py()

              QPoint end)
constructor
Parameters:

Method Detail

snapTol

public double snapTol()
returns the 'snap tolerance' associated with arrow items for the purpose of selecting items by clicking with the mouse. The snap tolerance for arrows is smaller than the usual snap tolerance for items so that arrows are not selected in preference to other nearby items.
Overrides:
snapTol in class QItem

setPos

public void setPos(int pos)
allows setting the position of an arrow relative to other arrows with same endpoints. The pos parameter specifies a positive or negative offset in pixels from the normal position (i.e., through the endpoints) which will be applied to the arrow
Parameters:
pos - positive or negative offset from normal arrow position in pixels

public QPoint start()
returns start point of arrow

public QPoint end()
returns end point of arrow

public int vx()
returns x component of vector in the direction of the arrow

vy

public int vy()
returns y component of vector in the direction of the arrow

ux

public double ux()
returns x component of unit vector in the direction of the arrow

uy

public double uy()
returns y component of unit vector in the direction of the arrow

px

public double px()
returns x component of unit vector perpendicular to arrow, where the unit vector is normalized so that its x component is non-negative

py

public double py()
returns y component of unit vector perpendicular to arrow, where the unit vector is normalized so that its x component is non-negative

startPosX

public int startPosX()
returns actual x coordinate of start of arrow, as determined by pos offset

startPosY

public int startPosY()
returns actual y coordinate of start of arrow, as determined by pos offset

endPosX

public int endPosX()
returns actual x coordinate of end of arrow, as determined by pos offset

endPosY

public int endPosY()
returns actual y coordinate of start of arrow, as determined by pos offset

norm

public double norm()
returns length of the arrow, which is defined to be the distance between its vertices, not the distance between the actual endpoints of the arrow as drawn

drawItem

protected void drawItem(Graphics2D g)
draws an arrow item. The actual endpoints of the arrow are adjusted first by applying the pos offset, if any, for multiple arrows. Then the endpoints are adjusted to avoid collisions with labels on the vertices
Overrides:
drawItem in class QItem
Parameters:
g - a graphics context onto which the item will be rendered

distance

public double distance(Point pt)
calculates the distance of the item from a coordinate (e.g., a mouse click)
Overrides:
distance in class QItem
Parameters:
pt - a coordinate

isDeleteItem

public boolean isDeleteItem()
returns true iff item should be deleted in the process of deleting selected items from a quiver. Arrows should be deleted if they are selected, or if either endpoint is selected. This can be overridden by the CAN_DELETE attribute
Overrides:
isDeleteItem in class QItem

hashKey

public String hashKey()
returns key uniquely determined by the endpoints (regardless of orientation) of arrow, for putting arrows in hash
